thread.title: Petron opens PSL bid against Cignal
thread.title_full: Petron opens PSL bid against Cignal | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Petron opens PSL bid against Cignal
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 10, 2015 Games Today
(Alonte Sports Complex, Biñan)
12 noon – Opening Ceremony
1 p.m. – Petron vs Cignal
3 p.m. – Meralco vs Foton
Powerhouse Petron opens its title-retention bid against Cignal as the Philippine Super Liga Grand Prix starts today at the Alonte Sports Complex in Biñan, Laguna.
Match is at 1 p.m. with the Blaze Spikers slightly favored over the Cignal squad owing to their recent stint in the 2015 AVC Asian Women’s Club Championship in Phy Ly, Vietnam where they sharpened their offensive attacks and developed their chemistry on and off the court.
Aside from the two Brazilians, the two-time champion team can also count on Maica Morada, Rachel Anne Daquis, Aby Marano and Dindin Santiago-Manabat for additional firepower.
The power-hitting Manabat is coming off a triumphant stint where she helped National University win the Shakey’s V-League Collegiate Conference title.
Morada, the team’s skipper, admits their Vietnam stint have made them stronger and more aggressive, saying: “It forged our bond and prepared us for the challenges of the PSL. We are now working on more combination plays on offense, improvement of our reception and net defense as well as communication inside the court in preparation for the Grand Prix.”
Out to provide stability for Cignal are former University of Arkansas middle blocker Amanda Anderson and hitter Ariel Usher.
